questions.text: A patient with a known macroprolactinoma (2.5 cm) not on any treatment presents with worsening headache with sudden loss of vision followed by impaired consciousness. Examination shows ophthalmoplegia and CT reveals hemorrhage within the tumor. What is the next best step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

It is a case of pituitary apoplexy with signs of increased intracranial pressure.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman complains of amenorrhea and spontaneous breast discharge. Visual field charting reveals temporal field defects. Her serum prolactin is 460 ng/mL and MRI shows a 1.8 cm pituitary mass. What is the most appropriate initial management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Dopamine agonist therapy decreases size of tumor.

questions.text: Which of the following is FALSE regarding Laron Syndrome (GH insensitivity?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

As receptors are defective Recombinant GH will not work

choices.text: Pegvisomant leads to increased GH receptor expression
Feedback inhibition of GH by IGF-1 is intact
Pegvisomant blocks GH receptor but not GH secretion
GH secretion is increased due to pituitary hemorrhage

questions.text: A 55-year-old man with acromegaly is treated Trans-sphenoidal surgical resection followed by Pegvisomant. After 6 months, IGF-1 normalizes, but GH levels remain high. What is the best explanation for the persistently elevated GH?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pegvisomant is GH receptor antagonist

questions.text: A 68-year-old smoker presents with recent-onset diabetes, hypertension, generalized weakness, and severe hypokalemia. He has no history of steroid use. Lab: cortisol not suppressed after 8 mg dexamethasone, ACTH markedly elevated. Chest CT shows a right hilar mass. Which of the following is most likely to be observed?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

This is ectopic ACTH syndrome, often due to small cell lung carcinoma. It presents with rapidly progressive Cushing’s, severe hypokalemia, metabolic alkalosis, and no suppression with high-dose dexamethasone.

questions.text: A patient with suspected Cushing’s syndrome undergoes initial evaluation. Her 24-hour urinary cortisol is elevated. Overnight 1 mg dexamethasone suppression test shows no suppression. Morning ACTH level is suppressed. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

ACTH-independent Cushing’s (i.e., adrenal source) shows low ACTH, no dexamethasone suppression, and elevated cortisol → points to adrenal adenoma or carcinoma.

choices.text: Chest and abdomen imaging for malignancy

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents with weight gain, facial puffiness, easy bruising, and proximal muscle weakness. She has poorly controlled diabetes and hypertension. Her labs show elevated ACTH, cortisol, and lack of suppression on 8 mg dexamethasone test. CRH stimulation leads to increased ACTH and cortisol. What is the next best step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

High-dose dexamethasone suppression negative and positive CRH stimulation test is indication for Inferior petrosal sinus sampling (IPSS).

questions.text: A 34-year-old male patient experiencing impotence was found to have increased prolactin and low testosterone concentrations. Patient is a known case of migraine and takes verapamil as prophylaxis and sumatriptan for acute attack since last 10 years. Magnetic resonance imaging showed a 6-mm lesion consistent with a pituitary microadenoma. What should be the next line of management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Withhold verapamil and observe

questions.text: Which of the following drug is not associated with hyperprolactinemia?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: A 46-year male comes to OPD complaining of tiredness. He has noticed weight loss over the last six months and irritation of the tip of his penis which appears inflamed on examination. He mentions he has been visiting the toilet more often than usual and feeling thirsty. The most appropriate investigation would be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Increase sugar urine causes infection.

questions.text: A 30-year-old obese female complains of tiredness. She has recently given birth to a healthy baby boy. However, she is becoming more reliant on her partner for support as she always feels exhausted and often becomes depressed. The patient has a poor appetite and often does not finish her meals, despite this she has gained 7 kg in the last 3 weeks. She also complains of constipation, excessive sleep & can not tolerate AC in room. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman has noticed a change in her appearance; most notably her clothes do not fit properly and are especially tight around the waist. Her face appears flushed and more rounded than usual, despite exercising regularly and eating healthily her weight has steadily increased over the last 3 weeks. On visiting her GP, he notices her blood pressure has increased since her last visit and she has bruises on her arm. She is especially worried about a brain tumour. The most appropriate investigation would be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

All are features of Cushing’s syndrome

questions.text: A 42-year-old man presents with pain, burning & tingling in right index finger & thumb. On enquiry patient gives history of difficulty in sleeping. He reports feeling increasingly tired and general weakness which he attributes to his poor sleep pattern. Additionally, the patient has noticed he has gained weight and sweats very easily. On examination, the patient has coarse facial features & weakness when gripping objects with right hand. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

All are features of acromegaly.

questions.text: A 48-year-old female presents with decreased sleep, visual disturbances & loose motions. In addition, she becomes breathless very easily and experiences palpitations. On examination, raised, painless lesions are observed on the front of her shins and finger clubbing. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Dermopathy is specific for Grave’s disease

questions.text: A 46-year-old female presents with swelling in her neck which she has noticed in the last 2 weeks. On enquiry patient also gives history of constipation & weight gain. The least appropriate investigation will be:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Anti-TSH receptor antibody: It is for GRAVE’S disease

choices.text: Measure plasma cortisol after giving injection CRH
Measure plasma ACTH after giving injection CRH

questions.text: A 46 year female complains of giddiness, weakness and feeling light-headed. She works as a teacher and most frequently experiences this when standing up from chair. She has never fainted. The patient has lost 6 kg, but attributes this to eating more healthily. She has noticed darkening of her palms. The most appropriate investigation is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

It is a case of Addison’s disease.

choices.text: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) brain for pituitary

questions.text: A 24 year old female presents with a 6 to 8 weeks history of polyuria and extreme thirst. The patient denies burning micturition. The patient does not have weight loss and no change in food habit. The most appropriate investigation is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

To differentiate Diabetes Insipidus and Psychogenic polydipsia

questions.text: A 74-year-old man admitted for fever, cough & breathlessness. After 2 days he developed confusion & was not able to recognise his family members. Blood results are as follows: Sodium 123 meq/L, Potassium 3.4 meq/L, Glucose (fasting) 100 mg/dl Urine osmolality 1189 mmol/L. MRI brain normal. Chest x ray film attached. The most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Chest X ray is suggestive of pneumonia. Pneumonia causes excessive release of ADH.

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman undergoes abortion in 9 weeks of pregnancy. Next day she developed severe headache, sweating & blurring of vision. On examination her blood pressure was 70/30 mmHg, heart rate is 148 bpm regular. Her laboratory tests are notable for glucose of 49 mg/dL, Hb-11.2 mg/dl, with normal haematocrit and white blood cell count. Which of the following drug is most likely to reverse her hypotension?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Post partum Hemorrhage leading to Pituitary apoplexy.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of primary hyperparathyroidism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Primary Hyperparathyroidism causes destruction of bone

questions.text: Which of the following can not differentiate diabetic ketoacidosis from hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Serum magnesium, chloride, phosphate remains normal in both

choices.text: Morning hyperglycemia due to insufficient insulin
Morning hypoglycemia due to excess insulin

questions.text: Which of the following statements about Somogyi effect is true?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Morning hyperglycemia with midnight hypoglycemia occurs in Somogyi effect

choices.text: Patient presents with ketoacidosis, but do not require long-term exogenous insulin therapy.
Defect in beta cells leading to hyperglycemia
Acute onset of type 1 diabetes because of viral infection of the islets
The development of a type 1 diabetes phenotype after 40 years of age

questions.text: “KETOSIS-PRONE DIABETES” means:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A. Patient presents with ketoacidosis, but do not require long-term exogenous insulin therapy.

B. Defect in beta cells leading to hyperglycemia - MODY

C. Acute onset of type 1 diabetes because of viral infection of the islets- FULMINANT DIABETES

D. The development of a type 1 diabetes phenotype after 40 years of age- 

The development of a type 2 diabetes phenotype before puberty ATYPICAL DIABETES.

questions.text: Which of the following statement about pseudohypoparathyroidism II is false?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

AHO is associated with PHPIa and PPHP.

questions.text: A 12 year old child having tingling sensations all over body and history of recurrent muscle cramps without any skeletal deformity visit OPD. Lab investigations are suggestive of hypocalcemia with hyperphosphatemia, increased serum PTH level and urinary c-AMP decreased. Which of the following is most probable diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Receptor defect with skeletal deformity occurs in PHPIa

questions.text: Which of the following is not a feature of hypercalcemia?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Muscle spasm is a feature of hypocalcemia

questions.text: The occurrence of hypothyroidism following administration of potassium iodide to a case of toxic adenoma is known as:
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Choose the best Lab value for a patient of SIADH insipidus
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Increase ADH increases water absorption

choices.text: Trans-sphenoidal surgical resection of pituitary adenoma

questions.text: A 46 year old male came to OPD with chief complaints of central obesity, purple stretch marks on abdomen, weight gain and redness of cheeks. No history of any drug. On examination BP 160/90 mmhg, proximal muscle weakness present. Blood investigations are RBS 334 mg/dl, serum potassium 2.9 mcg/L, serum ACTH level is decreased and serum cortisol level is increased. MRI brain showed pituitary adenoma. What should next appropriate step?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Serum ACTH level is decreased and serum cortisol level is increased suggestive of adrenal tumor.

questions.text: Which of the following can not differentiate Cushing’s disease with Ectopic ACTH secreting tumor?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Dexamethasone overnight test it will be positive in both

questions.text: A 50 year old male who is follow up case of pulmonary koch’s brought to emergency department in unconscious state. On examination pulse is feeble, BP unrecordable & RBS 46 mg/dl. On enquiry relative gave history of fever, loose motions & vomiting since last 3 days. Which of the following drug is not required?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

It is a case of adrenal crisis.

questions.text: A 36 year old male having drug resistant hypertension coming to OPD with severe headache. Blood reports showing hypokalemia on further investigations serum aldosterone level was increased with decreased plasma renin activity. Diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism is confirmed by saline infusion test. CT adrenal is normal. Which of the following is next best step in management?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

choices.text: Aldosterone secretion is controlled by Renin
Aldosterone secretion is controlled by ACTH
Hypertension with hypokalemia is characteristic feature

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Glucocorticoid Remediable Aldosteronism?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In GRA Aldosterone secretion is controlled by ACTH not by RENIN

choices.text: Aldosterone secretion is regulated by ACTH
Hypertension with hypokalemia is characteristic feature

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding SAME?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Aldosterone secretion is regulated by Renin not by ACTH

questions.text: Which of the following defect is correctly matched with type of MODY?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

choices.text: Fasting blood sugar between 100 to 125 mg/dl
2 hour post-prandil glucose between 140 to 199 mg/dl
Random blood glucose between 130 to 180 mg/dl with symptoms of diabetes

questions.text: Which of the following condition is not considered as a PREDIABETIC?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)

questions.text: Fructoseamine assay measures
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Fructoseamine assay measures Glycated albumin

questions.text: Which of the following is longest acting insulin?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Name of the sign shown in the figure
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Conn’s syndrome is associated with all, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Edema is absent is CONN’S syndrome

questions.text: In a patient if administration of exogenous vasopressin does not increase the osmolality of urine the likely cause is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

V2 receptors are not responding to ADH

questions.text: Mainstay of treatment of nephrogenic diabetes insipidus is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Thiazide/Amiloride diureties causes of loss of sodium.

questions.text: All are seen in DKA except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Bradycardia is not the feature of DKA

questions.text: A 44 year old male having drug resistant hypertension coming to OPD with severe headache. Blood reports showing hypokalemia on further investigations serum aldosterone level was increased with decreased plasma renin activity. Diagnosis of primary hyperaldosteronism is confirmed by saline infusion test. CT adrenal showed right adrenal adenoma. Which of the following is next best step in management?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Active adrenal adenoma is rare after age of 40 years

questions.text: Which of the following is not used in treatment of Syndrome of inappropriate ADH secretion?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 Conivaptan
It is not approved for SIADH.

questions.text: All of the following can cause pituitary apoplexy except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyperthyroidism
Diabetes mellitus, Sickle cell anemia, Hypertension ans Sheehan’s syndrome are associated with pituitary apoplexy.

choices.text: Increase in serum osmolality and decrease in urine osmolality

questions.text: A 24-year-old female meets with an accident with resultant transaction of the pituitary stalk; what will NOT occur:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hyperpigmentation
As CRH will decrease ACTH will also decrease. ACTH stimulates melanocytes.
b. Increase in serum osmolality and decrease in urine osmolality – because of central Diabetes insipidus
c. Galactorrhoea because of Hyperprolactinemia due to decreased Dopamine secretion from hypothalamus to pituitary 
d. Intolerance to cold – Because of Hypothyroidism due to decreased TRH

questions.text: A 30-year-old male complains of loss of erection; he has low testosterone and high prolactin level in blood; What is the likely diagnosis:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Pituitary adenoma

It is case of Prolactinoma. As PRL inhibits GnRH.

questions.text: In a patient suffering from thyrotoxicosis the thyroid scintigraphy is as shown in the figure the most likely diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Graves’ disease
Homogenous distribution

questions.text: A 75-year-old lady with fracture neck of femur presents with two days history of altered sensorium and decreased urine output. Serum calcium is 15.5 mg/dL, Urea is 140 mg/dL, Creatinine is 2 mg/dL. All of the following are useful for immediate management of hypercalcemia, except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Bisphosphonates

It inhibits breakdown of bone by inhibiting osteoclast cells.
